attachments.fallback:
<@U01TLRS1W9L>: Hi, I'd like to ask a question! Please check the details.
*Question title:* `Removal of /calculate/batch API in price-service`
*Topic:* `Other`
*Details:* `Hi, we are going to deprecate /calculate/batch API in price-service soon. The last major sources of requests to this API were GoodChop and ThePetsTable. Last week, the GoodChop team made the changes and they no longer call the API. Now I see ThePetsTable is #1 caller of the API. Can you check what are the use-cases to call /calculate/batch in price-service? Can we disable the API without negative consequences on the user-experience?`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-question
attachments.text:
<@U01TLRS1W9L>: Hi, I'd like to ask a question! Please check the details.
*Question title:* `Removal of /calculate/batch API in price-service`
*Topic:* `Other`
*Details:* `Hi, we are going to deprecate /calculate/batch API in price-service soon. The last major sources of requests to this API were GoodChop and ThePetsTable. Last week, the GoodChop team made the changes and they no longer call the API. Now I see ThePetsTable is #1 caller of the API. Can you check what are the use-cases to call /calculate/batch in price-service? Can we disable the API without negative consequences on the user-experience?`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-question

_thread_replies.text:
:sparkles: *Automatic Answer:* 
Here's a summary of the situation and recommended actions:

1. The `/calculate/batch` API in price-service is being deprecated.
2. GoodChop has already stopped using the API.
3. ThePetsTable is currently the top caller of this API.

To address this issue:

1. *Investigate ThePetsTable usage*:
   - Check the `/my-deliveries/` page, as RTE brands primarily call the API from there.
   - Understand the specific use-case for ThePetsTable.

2. *Consider alternatives*:
   - The Pricing team has implemented `/calculate/prospect/batch` API for batch calculation use-cases.
   - Evaluate if this new endpoint can replace the deprecated one for ThePetsTable.

3. *Coordinate with teams*:
   - Work with the ThePetsTable team to plan the migration away from `/calculate/batch`.
   - Consult with the Pricing team for any additional guidance or alternatives.

4. *Set a timeline*:
   - Aim to complete the migration before mid-June, if possible.

5. *Monitor and test*:
   - Ensure the migration doesn't negatively impact user experience.
   - Thoroughly test any changes before disabling the API.

For more details, please visit <https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C08A4BCMD39/p1747321985131019?thread_ts=1747321985.131019&utm_source=slack-commander|here>
 *Additional sources:*
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C02GJBXSYMD/p1738938374866059?thread_ts=1738938374.866059&utm_source=slack-commander|[Q&A] Feedback regarding potential changes in calculate API>
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C02GJBXSYMD/p1746453326515149?thread_ts=1746453326.515149&utm_source=slack-commander|[Q&A] Update legacy request to calculate batch on > :warning:_This answer was generated based on the available documentation mentioned above, proceed with caution._

Does this resolve your query, <@U01TLRS1W9L>? Yes, resolve it button No, open Unified Search button No, I need help button

_thread_replies.text:
HI <@U8F7ZDAPM> the `calculate/prospect/batch` is intended for prospects only. For us prospects are those who don't have customer/plan IDs and aren't registered.
When it comes to reactivation use-case - we are talking about registered  customers, as far as I know - pricing team has built a dedicated API for it - <https://hellodev.hellofresh.io/project/price-service/api#/default/post_reactivations_checkout_price|/reactivations/checkout/price>

<@UFC7CRXMZ>: Hi, I'd like to ask a question! Please check the details.
*Question title:* `50% Portion Size Data`
*Topic:* `Other`
*Details:* `Hi! We aren't able to track uptake of our 50% Portions Fresh plan since we made the change to integrate it to the Fresh plan a few months back. Previously, it was a separate Topper SKU that was selected.

Is there any way that we can track how many customers have selected a 50% Portion Size plan for Fresh?

`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-question
attachments.text:
<@UFC7CRXMZ>: Hi, I'd like to ask a question! Please check the details.
*Question title:* `50% Portion Size Data`
*Topic:* `Other`
*Details:* `Hi! We aren't able to track uptake of our 50% Portions Fresh plan since we made the change to integrate it to the Fresh plan a few months back. Previously, it was a separate Topper SKU that was selected.

Is there any way that we can track how many customers have selected a 50% Portion Size plan for Fresh?

`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-question

_thread_replies.text:
:sparkles: *Automatic Answer:* 
Based on the provided context, it appears that tracking 50% Portion Size plans for Fresh is not directly possible after the integration. However, here are some potential approaches:

1. Use the Nutritional Profile Service (NPS) data:
   * NPS was updated with 50% portion information for customers who were migrated from topper product SKUs.
   * You may be able to query this data to identify customers with 50% portions.

2. Check the `perPortion` field in API responses:
   * The meal plans API includes a `perPortion` field that specifies the portion size for each SKU.
   * You could potentially use this to identify orders with 50% portions.

3. Review migration data:
   * There were spreadsheets created during the migration process that listed customers moving from topper to fresh plans.
   * These might serve as a starting point for identifying customers who were on 50% portion plans.

To get more accurate data, you may need to collaborate with the New Ventures Systems team or the team responsible for the NPS to create a specific query or report for tracking 50% Portion Size plans within the Fresh plan.

For more details, please visit <https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C088GTM8QTF/p1744208883466679?thread_ts=1744208883.466679&utm_source=slack-commander|here>
 *Additional sources:*
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C04FVDBJZCK/p1702329462789959?thread_ts=1702329462.789959&utm_source=slack-commander|[Q&A] Invalid meal selection in SCM export> :warning:_This answer was generated based on the available documentation mentioned above, proceed with caution._

Does this resolve your query, <@UFC7CRXMZ>? Unified Search :mag: button

_thread_replies.text:
<@UFC7CRXMZ>, keep in mind that the subscription or customer ID data for users who dont create accounts will not be available.

I created a <https://hf-query-engine.cloud.databricks.com/sql/editor/14c082fd-6bd4-4f29-980e-173215f45475?o=1352089065939666|query>, which you can rerun (I assume you will be looking at this data on a continous basis)

```SELECT
    uid as customer_id,
    event_label, 
    fk_date,
    page_path 
FROM big_query.ga_events
--adjust the date in the format YYYYMMDD
WHERE fk_date BETWEEN 20250601 AND 20250715
AND event_action = 'go to cart'
AND event_category = 'funnel'
AND country = 'KN'```
Some notes:
• in the event label you can find SKU (e.g. KN-TFR-1-350-0), as well as portion percentage. If the numbrt is 50, it means that the user has selected Topper 
• You can reconfirm if it is topper by comparing calculated calories in url with the allocated SKU

elements.text:

I created a
query
, which you can rerun (I assume you will be looking at this data on a continous basis)

    event_label, 
    fk_date,
    page_path 
FROM big_query.ga_events
--adjust the date in the format YYYYMMDD
WHERE fk_date BETWEEN 20250601 AND 20250715
AND event_action = 'go to cart'
AND event_category = 'funnel'
AND country = 'KN'
Some notes:
in the event label you can find SKU (e.g. KN-TFR-1-350-0), as well as portion percentage. If the numbrt is 50, it means that the user has selected Topper
You can reconfirm if it is topper by comparing calculated calories in url with the allocated SKU

I could do a left join with a different table and connect the customer_id, with its subscription_id, but for multipet the mapping can be faulty

I could do a left join with a different table and connect the customer_id, with its subscription_id, but for multipet the mapping can be faulty

<@U047SAC2PPV>: Hi, I'd like to ask a question! Please check the details.
*Question title:* `What was deleted during the SKU migration`
*Topic:* `Other`
*Details:* `Couple of weeks ago, TPT migrated bunch of subscription to a new SKU. Also, some SKUs were deleted from CCM.
I wanna understand what was actually deleted, was it a menu or a product family?

For context, we are working on making some changes to KRS to handle these cases were TPT wants to discontinue a product, so we want to know what is exactly going to be removed

This is the draft of our ADR: <https://github.com/hellofresh/kafka-recurring-selection-service/pull/244#discussion_r2195034159>`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-question
attachments.text:
<@U047SAC2PPV>: Hi, I'd like to ask a question! Please check the details.
*Question title:* `What was deleted during the SKU migration`
*Topic:* `Other`
*Details:* `Couple of weeks ago, TPT migrated bunch of subscription to a new SKU. Also, some SKUs were deleted from CCM.
I wanna understand what was actually deleted, was it a menu or a product family?

For context, we are working on making some changes to KRS to handle these cases were TPT wants to discontinue a product, so we want to know what is exactly going to be removed

This is the draft of our ADR: <https://github.com/hellofresh/kafka-recurring-selection-service/pull/244#discussion_r2195034159>`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-question

_thread_replies.text:
:sparkles: *Automatic Answer:* 
Based on the provided context, it appears that during the SKU migration:

1. *Subscription products* were updated from old SKUs to new SKUs
2. *Unit prices* were updated for the migrated subscriptions
3. *Meal selections* were retained during the migration

The migration did not involve deleting menus or product families. Instead, it focused on:

- Updating existing subscriptions to use new SKUs
- Adjusting prices for the migrated subscriptions
- Maintaining customer meal preferences

It's important to note that while the subscription-level changes were successful, some legacy data might still be visible in certain interfaces (like Bob) for past orders or recurring deliveries. However, new orders and deliveries should use the updated SKUs.

For handling product discontinuation in KRS, consider:

1. Updating subscription products to new SKUs
2. Maintaining meal selections where possible
3. Ensuring new orders use the updated SKUs
4. Handling potential legacy data display issues in admin interfaces

For more details, please visit <https://github.com/hellofresh/kafka-recurring-selection-service/pull/244#discussion_r2195034159|here>
 *Additional sources:*
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C049H9UE22X/p1740669183948089?thread_ts=1740669183.948089&utm_source=slack-commander|[Q&A] Is there a risk of the subscribed meal preference getting updated when carrying out subscribed product sku migrations?>
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C04FVDBJZCK/p1750238911113239?thread_ts=1750238911.113239&utm_source=slack-commander|[Q&A] List of removed SKUs from TPT> :warning:_This answer was generated based on the available documentation mentioned above, proceed with caution._

Does this resolve your query, <@U047SAC2PPV>? Unified Search :mag: button

_thread_replies.text:
We completely migrated NMPS to FTCP.

On staging, we don't even have the app on the legacy cluster anymore and everything goes directly to the FTCP

For live, We are serving 100% of the traffic from FTCP, but we still have the apps running on the legacy cluster as well, so we can switch back in case of something goes wrong. I'll remove the app from the legacy cluster for live, early next week :slightly_smiling_face:

*Topic:* `Other`
*Details:* `Hi, we're testing to make sure add-on discounts work for all categories but right now it's only applying for supplements. Can someone confirm that these are the right skus for add-on categories?
KN-CRT-0-0-0 >> supplements
KN-TRT-0-0-0 >> treats
KN-ADP-0-0-0 >> air dried bags`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-question

_thread_replies.text:
:sparkles: *Automatic Answer:* 
Based on the information provided in the context, I cannot confirm if the SKUs you mentioned are the correct ones for add-on categories. However, I can provide some relevant information:

1. The SKU format you've provided (`KN-CRT-0-0-0`, `KN-TRT-0-0-0`, `KN-ADP-0-0-0`) appears to be consistent with The Pets Table (KN) SKU format.

2. Add-on discount functionality may not be fully enabled for The Pets Table (TPT). This could explain why the discount is only applying to supplements.

3. To resolve this issue, you may need to:
   - Confirm if add-on discount functionality is enabled for TPT
   - Check if the SKUs are correctly whitelisted in the discount settings
   - Verify if there are any frontend issues preventing the discount from applying correctly

For more detailed assistance, you may want to reach out to the alliance-tam-expansion team or the team responsible for TPT's frontend.
 *Additional sources:*
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/CQQNMEPK2/p1712566668849269?thread_ts=1712566668.849269&utm_source=slack-commander|[Q&A] Add-on + surcharge skus for IE>
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C04FVDBJZCK/p1687388032715719?thread_ts=1687388032.715719&utm_source=slack-commander|[Q&A] SKU Whitelisting> :warning:_This answer was generated based on the available documentation mentioned above, proceed with caution._
